intro: Manilkara siqueiraei, commonly known as the Brazilian shea tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain a single seed. Its latex, similar to that of the shea tree, is used in traditional medicine and industrial applications. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
